title: Hoya Vision Care Makes Two New Leadership Appointments
text: PEOPLE Hoya Vision Care Makes Two New Leadership Appointments By Staff Thursday, September 4, 2025 12:21 AM Meg Weathers. LEWISVILLE, Texas—Hoya Vision Care recently announced two key leadership appointments aimed at strengthening its strategic and commercial operations across the North America market. Meg Weathers has been appointed senior vice president, global key accounts for North America, a pivotal commercial leadership role where she will spearhead growth initiatives and deepen relationships with global key account customers, the company said. Samy Lauriette has been named vice president of strategic marketing for North America, according to the announcement. These appointments underscore Hoya Vision Care’s commitment to investing in strong leadership to drive innovation, operational excellence, and sustained growth in North America, the announcement said. The company said Weathers’ focus will be on expanding Hoya’s footprint, driving volume, and growing market share through strategic partnerships and tailored solutions. She previously led Hoya’s North American marketing organization with distinction and brings over 16 years of experience in the optical industry. Her background in business development, global strategy, and commercial marketing positions her to accelerate Hoya’s performance in a competitive landscape, the company said. “These appointments reflect our continued commitment to strengthening Hoya’s strategic and commercial capabilities in North America,” said Eduardo Martins, president of Hoya Vision Care, North America. Samy Lauriette. In Lauriette’s senior executive role, he will lead Hoya’s marketing organization across the U.S. and Canada, overseeing product management, professional affairs, channel and digital marketing, and brand communications. Hoya Vision Care said that through leveraging Hoya’s marketing resources, his priority is to strengthen partnerships with eyecare professionals by promoting Hoya’s industry-leading ophthalmic lens products and lab services to ensure the best vision solutions for their patients. Bringing more than 20 years of international experience in the optical and hearing care industries, Lauriette is recognized for his expertise in strategic planning, innovation, and driving commercial excellence. Hoya Vision Care added that his leadership will be instrumental in equipping eyecare professionals with the tools and strategies needed to enhance patient outcomes and elevate vision care standards. “Meg Weathers and Samy Lauriette bring exceptional leadership and deep industry expertise that will help us accelerate innovation, deepen customer partnerships, and deliver even greater value to eyecare professionals and their patients,” Martins said.
